credentials.description: Recuerda que el usuario que creas aquí está {highlight}, independientemente de la cuenta creada en la web.
credentials.label_password_backup_reminder: rotki guarda todos los datos del usuario localmente. Entiendo que si pierdo mi contraseña, perderé acceso a mis datos. He creado una copia de seguridad de la contraseña.
credentials.password_sync_requirement: Asegúrate de que la cuenta utilice la misma contraseña que la base de datos respaldada originalmente. No podrás acceder a la base de datos si ingresas una contraseña diferente.

validation.check_prompt: Confirma que has leído y creado una copia de seguridad

validation.valid_username: Un nombre de perfil debe contener solo caracteres alfanuméricos y no tener espacios

introduction.description:
rotki es una aplicación local que respeta tu privacidad.

Las cuentas de rotki están encriptadas usando tu contraseña y {highlight}.

La cuenta que creas aquí solo es útil para la aplicación; en la web utilizamos una base de datos diferente.
introduction.highlight: guardada en tu sistema de archivos local

premium.premium_question:
¿Ya eres un usuario premium de rotki y quieres habilitar funciones premium?
Esto es necesario si deseas sincronizar tu base de datos de rotki desde otro dispositivo al crear la cuenta. Puedes comprar premium {premiumLink}

step_2.description: ¿Tienes una cuenta premium en nuestro sitio web?
step_2.title: Habilitar Premium

usage_analytics.description: rotki es una aplicación local y el análisis de uso anónimo es la única forma que tenemos de tener una idea de cuántas personas utilizan nuestro software, de dónde son, etc. Estos datos son muy importantes para nosotros, son completamente anónimos y nos ayudan a crear un mejor producto para ti.

external_services.subtitle: rotki connects to various service providers in order to obtain information such as historical prices or blockchain data. In certain cases rotki depends on these APIs for basic information, in which case you will need to provide an API key.

failed.unignore_message: {length} asset(s) could not be removed from ignored assets: {message}

binance.line_one: Las columnas que procesamos incluyen: User_ID, UTC_Time, Account, Operation, Coin, Change y Remark.
binance.line_two: Puede obtener el archivo CSV en {link}.
binance.line_three: Debido al formato CSV de Binance, existe la posibilidad de que no se importen todos los datos. Si esto ocurre, recibirás una advertencia.
binance.name: Binance

bisq.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
bisq.name: Bisq

bitcoin_tax.line_one: We support the import of trades, income and spending csv file types.
bitcoin_tax.line_three: The ‘swap’ action of the trade file type that represents a coin rename or a fork, is treated elsewhere by rotki so no history event needs to be created for it.
bitcoin_tax.line_two: All imported events are mapped to rotki’s history events.
bitcoin_tax.name: bitcoin.tax

bitmex.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
bitmex.line_two: Amounts in the wallet history file are assumed to be Bitcoin. If you would like this feature supported for other currencies, please reach out.
bitmex.name: BitMEX

blockfi.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
blockfi.line_two: BlockFi lets you export two different files. Trades will be imported from the file that only contains trades.
blockfi.name: BlockFi

cointracking.line_one: Trades/deposits/withdrawals from CoinTracking do not include fees.
cointracking.line_three: ETH/BTC Transactions are treated as deposits/withdrawals so they are not imported in rotki. To import ETH transactions simply input your accounts in {0} and they will be imported automatically for you.
cointracking.line_two: All trades imported from CoinTracking will always be considered as buys due to the way the data are represented.
cointracking.name: CoinTracking
cointracking.preferred: For the above reasons it's preferred to directly connect your exchanges in order to import data from there. If you do not do that a lot of accuracy is lost.

cryptocom.line_four: Only transactions are imported here (for tax report), if you want the assets be displayed in your rotki balances, you have to add them manually as manual balances: {0}
cryptocom.line_one: [Early stage] This import script may miss some transactions types, like withdrawals. Since we can't have an exhaustive list of every type, we develop it using what we know at the time. If you think that import script can be improved and you can help providing more data types, {0}.
cryptocom.line_three: Trades/deposits/withdrawals from crypto.com do not include fees details. They are waived at the moment (August 2020) or they are handled in the traded amount.
cryptocom.line_two: {0} If you want to connect your Crypto.com Exchange account, please wait until we support it and then connect to it as an exchange.
cryptocom.line_two_warning: It only concerns the Crypto.com mobile application.
cryptocom.name: Crypto.com

import_data.description: You can manually import data from the services below by dragging the file on the respective area or clicking the select button.

nexo.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
nexo.name: Nexo

import_data.note: Important notes for importing data from {0}'s CSV exports.
import_data.notice: Those platforms could change their format in a backwards incompatible way quite often. As such this import may stop working. If that happens {link} and we will see what we can do.

shapeshift.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
shapeshift.line_two: ShapeShift lets you export a trades file. Trades will be imported from the file that only contains trades.
shapeshift.name: ShapeShift

import_data.title: Import Data

uphold.line_one: [Experimental] If you find an issue with the imported data, let us know so we can adapt the code accordingly.
uphold.line_two: Uphold lets you export a transactions file. It can be found under activity at the top right of the activity list.
uphold.name: Uphold

kucoin.line_one: Admitimos la importación de ficheros de tipo csv.
kucoin.name: Kucoin

rpc_node_form.owned_hint: Enable if this node is a private node owned by the user

snapshot_action_button.ignore_errors_tooltip: Save the balance snapshot ignoring any errors on external APIs. This can cause the snapshot to be incomplete.
snapshot_action_button.menu_tooltip: View the date of the last balances snapshot

messages.success_description: Snapshot successfully imported. You will be logged out now.
messages.title: Snapshot import

snapshot_action_button.snapshot_tooltip: This will force taking a snapshot of all your balances, ignoring any cache. Use this sparingly as it may lead to you being rate-limited.

staking_page.dropdown_hint: Select a location to see more details

page.description: Select one of the supported locations to see more information about your staked assets.
page.title: Staking Locations

infer_zero_timed_balances.label: Infer zero timed balances for assets that have no balance at a specific time. This is useful for showing zero balance periods in graphs.
infer_zero_timed_balances.title: Infer zero timed balances

multiplier.label: Multiplier
multiplier.off: No missed snapshots will be considered as being zero.
multiplier.on: If there is a period of {period} hours or more between two existing balance snapshots then the graph will consider zero balances for that period.
multiplier.subtitle: Set after how many hours between two existing balance snapshots the graph will consider zero balances for that period.
multiplier.title: Missing snapshot multiplier

sync_buttons.download_tooltip: Pull the saved data from the server and replace your local database
sync_buttons.upload_tooltip: Push your local database to the server and replace all data there

sync_indicator.last_data_upload: Última sincronización premium de la base de datos
sync_indicator.menu_tooltip: View the time of the last premium database sync and perform manual sync.

upload_confirmation.message_download: By force pulling, your local database will be replaced with data pulled from the rotki server. There is no way to recover any overwritten data, or revert this action. Please be careful when performing this action as it may cause unintended data loss. By proceeding you acknowledge that you understand the dangers of using this action.
upload_confirmation.message_download_relogin: After performing the pull, a manual re-login will be required.
upload_confirmation.message_upload: By force pushing, any previous synced data residing in the rotki server will be overwritten. There is no way to recover any overwritten data, or revert this action. Please be careful when performing this action as it may cause unintended data loss. By proceeding you acknowledge that you understand the dangers of using this action.
upload_confirmation.title: Forzar subida | Forzar bajada
